oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sorption of dissolved organic C and P to agricultural top- and subsoil
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gjettermann, Birgitte
Styczen, Merete
Hansen, Søren
Borggaard, Ole K.
Hansen, Hans C.B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Environmental aspects
Nutrient turnover
Soil biology
Soil quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In order to study the mobility of dissolved organic carbon (DOC) and dissolved organic P (DOP) in soil, the pH-dependent sorption of dissolved organic matter to an agricultural top- and subsoil was investigated. In general, sorption isotherms had convex shapes and DOC and DOP sorption increased with time of reaction. There was a very pronounced effect of pH resulting in much higher sorption of DOC at pH 5 than at pH 7; actually extensive desorption was observed at pH 7 especially for the topsoil. Similar sorption patterns were observed for DOP, but they were not as pronounced as for DOC.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: ATV-fonden for jord og grundvand. DTU.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Gjettermann, Birgitte; Styczen, Merete; Hansen, Søren; Borggaard, Ole K. and Hansen, Hans C.B. (2004) Sorption of dissolved organic C and P to agricultural top- and subsoil. In: Bruun, Bente (Ed.) ATV Jord og Grundvand. Vintermøde om jord- og grundvandsforurerening., ATV-fonden for jord og grundvand. DTU., pp. 435-444.
